text: with the game of pool lasting mere
minutes you need a pocket full of coins
for a serious session when you want to
rack up another round how does this
machine make sure you pay to play when
you push the coins in with the slide
they roll past a magnet that checks the
metal content then they trigger a series
of steel switches to free the coin slide
this glides in to push a lever and pivot
the rack holding the balls a middle gate
holds them in place until you pull the
coin slide back out when they've wrapped
up and the next game begins players want
the ball to rebound at predictable
angles to do that
the cushions must push the ball back at
the same speed it hits the careful craft
and every cushion make sure players get
a reliable rebound every time but
there's one hazard that can trip up even
the greatest player pocketing the cue
ball how does it come back when the
others stay sunk right under the slate
top is the spider a maze of one-ways
that catches colored balls and dumps
them in the hold
but it can't catch the cue ball it's
white coating conceals a thin layer of
iron a strong magnet attracts the metal
to pull the cue ball out of the chute
and channel it back into play every
single time thanks to the magnetic
return pocketing the cue ball might lose
you your cool but it won't mean the end
of your game
